column4: So.. running Ubuntu on amd64 is just an absolutely moot point or? :S
anything that wasn't installed along with the fresh install of Ubuntu
Except for Thunderbird mail client
AbiWord word Processor, Amarok, Gnumeric Spreadsheet, gFTP
to name a few
I tried to install kvirc(sp?) and got that error message
and then when I looked more closely, almost everything else gave me that too :/
now it just gives me that error as soon as I click the checkbox
for any application
can't even remove any packages
can you repeat that error message for me (late comer)
what package manager are you using?
could you put your /etc/apt/sources.list on the pastebin please
what do you get when you type in a terminal 'sudo apt-get update ; sudo apt-get install gnumeric'
is that with the command I gave you?
give me a minute...
I suggest you try to connect to the de. mirror instead of is. Do 'sudo sed 's/is\./de\./g' /etc/apt/sources.list'
everything inside the outer quotes -- then the previous command again.
the sed command hasn't worked then... hold on...
installations work, too?
something must be wrong in Iceland, then ;)
